results.title: Journey into the past: the story of the ancient civilizations of the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: Serves as a historical introduction to the early civilizations around the Mediterranean and provides a geographical background to the histories of Egypt, Greece and Rome. Shows archaeological discoveries including remains of the Roman civilization in Britain. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Journey into spring
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Ian Ferguson, Edgar H. Anstey and Ralph Keene
results.brief_description: Spring comes to Selborne, where the 18th century naturalist Gilbert White made his record of the wild life in his Hampshire parish; rook and dabchick; frog and slow-worm, hedgehog, mole and vole; pussywillow, catkin, celandine, primrose. Two centuries later, as these and other forms of life respond to the seasonal rhythm, the story of spring is patiently recorded by probing camera and microphone and by the evocative words of Laurie Lee.

results.title: Journey into friendship
results.creator_credit: Carol Hale, World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts and Wheaton Galentine
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how girl scouting and guiding opens the door to lasting friendships between girls of different countries focusing attention on girls from Ceylon, Denmark and Peru who are attending an annual Juliette Low gathering at ‘Our Cabana’ in Cuernavaca Mexico. Shows the girls in their homelands: in Peru making pottery, nursing, teaching native dances; in Denmark cycling and camping; in Ceylon doing social service work in a poverty stricken village. Narrated by Alan Stern. Photographed by Wheaton Galentine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carol Hale, World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts and Wheaton Galentine

results.title: Journey in France
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Gunther V. Fritsch
results.brief_description: A picture of France seen through the eyes of the two daughters of a barge family as they travel the rivers and canals from Marseilles to Strasbourg. Presents a panorama of the history, geography, and economy of the country, and portrays the character of the French working people.

results.title: Journey home
results.creator_credit: Maria De Maria and Valarie De Maria
results.brief_description: Maria tells us the story of migration, hard work, loneliness and sacrifice that was her experience of leaving her native land to move to the other side of the world. There were many hard times, and she still misses Italy ‘but now I call Australia home’. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
